articles.title: Kim Jong Un Has Photo Session with Participants in National Meeting of Light Industrial Workers
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Has Photo Session with Participants in National Meeting of Light Industrial Workers
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- Marshal Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, had a photo session with the participants in the national meeting of light industrial workers on Tuesday.
					 Kim Jong Un said that the meeting loudly sounded the drive on the front of the light industry for improving the people's living standard and made the torchlight for innovations kindled in the light industry furiously flare up for a fresh leap forward in agriculture and all economic sectors. He warmly congratulated the participants on having successfully carried out their work with high enthusiasm and active participation and had a photo taken with them.
					
					 He expressed belief that working people, officials, scientists and technicians in the field of light industry and related fields playing important roles in improving the people's living standard would perform their duties for developing the light industry as required by the building of a thriving socialist nation.
					
					 Present there were Choe Yong Rim, Kim Kyong Hui, Kim Ki Nam, Mun Kyong Dok, Ro Tu Chol, Pak Pong Ju, Ri Mu Yong, chief secretaries of the WPK provincial committees and chairmen of the provincial people's committees.

articles.title: SPA Chairman Meets New Indian Ambassador
articles.content:
SPA Chairman Meets New Indian Ambassador
						
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, chairman of the Supreme People's Assembly (SPA) of the DPRK, met and had a talk with Ajay Kumar Sharma, Indian ambassador to the DPRK, who paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Tuesday.

articles.title: DPRK Software Industry Delegation Comes Back
articles.content:
DPRK Software Industry Delegation Comes Back
						
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the General Bureau of Software Industry of the DPRK headed by Vice General Director Jong Song Chan came back home on Tuesday after wrapping up its visit to Laos.

articles.title: Russian Ambassador Hosts Reception
articles.content:
Russian Ambassador Hosts Reception
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- Alexandr Timonin, Russian ambassador to the DPRK, hosted a reception at his embassy on Tuesday on the occasion of the 64th anniversary of the conclusion of the agreement on economic and cultural cooperation between the DPRK and Russia.
					 Present there on invitation were Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, So Ho Won, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries who doubles as chairman of the DPRK-Russia Friendship Association, and officials concerned.

articles.title: UNSC Is Tool for Imperialists' High-handed, Arbitrary Practices (1): News Analyst
articles.content:
UNSC Is Tool for Imperialists' High-handed, Arbitrary Practices (1): News Analyst
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- As well known, the United States prodded the UN Security Council into fabricating unprecedentedly base and wicked "resolutions on sanctions" against the DPRK over its satellite launch for peaceful purposes and third underground nuclear test for self-defence. These were hideous crimes.
					 Not content with making desperate efforts to isolate the DPRK internationally, the U.S. cooked up such base "resolutions" by abusing the UNSC, its hand-raising machine. This was the most vivid expression of its wild ambition to stifle the DPRK and last-ditch effort to escalate its campaign against the DPRK.
					
					 The imperialists have reduced the UNSC to such an alarming "impeachment tribunal" as a religious court in the medieval ages. They ran the entire gamut of high-handed and arbitrary practices at the UNSC in wanton violation of the interests and rights of small countries and anti-imperialist and independent countries to meet their interests. 
					
					 Countless are unpardonable crimes the imperialists have committed against the world by abusing the UNSC for their aggressive purposes. 
					
					  The U.S. emerged the world's "only superpower" when the balance of forces was upset in the international arena after the demise of the Cold War. The U.S.-led imperialists reduced the UNSC to a lawless one under the reign of the law of the jungle by dominating it.
					
					 The 78-day-long barbarous air raids committed by the U.S.-led NATO forces on former Yugoslavia late in the  20th century were, in fact, a war of monstrous genocide in which they indiscriminately  dropped bombs on peaceable inhabitants by the mandate of the UNSC in utter disregard of international law. 
					
					 In 1998 the U.S. and the West kicked off a pressure campaign to brand Yugoslavia as a "war criminal" over the Kosovo issue.
					
					 They brought the issue up for discussion at the UNSC and prodded it into adopting a resolution on taking steps for an embargo on arms export to Yugoslavia and a resolution on pressurizing it to accept a UN investigation into "human rights abuses" in Kosovo. Finally, the UNSC cooked up a resolution calling for taking "a crucial additional international step" against Yugoslavia unless it makes a truce in Kosovo.
					
					 This gave a green light to a military intervention in Yugoslavia. Extremely arrogant NATO forces launched indiscriminate air raids on Yugoslavia in March, 1999 without getting any UNSC's approval, a procedure they were obliged to go through under international law.
					
					 The world public expressed strong anger and deep concern over the illegal air raids made by NATO in disregard of the UN and the UNSC.
					
					 "NATO forces' air raids on Yugoslavia may serve as a funeral song for the UN." "It cast a dark shadow on the mode of establishing a new international order after the demise of the Cold War." "The UN was founded for the purpose of preventing a conflict, but NATO air raids put its existence at peril."
					
					 No wonder, the then Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs of Russia Vasily Sredin said at a meeting of the UN Human Rights Commission that "Yugoslavia was attacked today, but tomorrow another country may fall victim to an attack."

articles.title: Students Continue 1 000-ri Journey for Learning
articles.content:
Students Continue 1 000-ri Journey for Learning
						
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- Members of the group of schoolchildren across the country making 1 000-ri journey for learning arrived in Kanggye Tuesday. They departed Phophyong Saturday to mark the 90th anniversary of the journey made by President Kim Il Sung.
					 Members of the group laid a floral basket before the statues of the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il in Kanggye City and paid tribute to them.
					
					 They held a meeting of sending a telegram to the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un before the Kanggye Post Office where the President sent 6-character telegram "Kang Gye Mu Sa To Chak" (Safe Arrival in Kanggye) to his father Kim Hyong Jik on March 20, 1923.
					
					 The telegram was read out at the meeting.
					
					 In the telegram the members of the group informed him of their safe arrival in Kanggye after they left Phophyong on the day when the President set out on the 1 000-ri journey for learning 90 years ago.
					
					 Following the historic course covered by the President, they came to know the intention why Kim Jong Un saw to it that they made the journey at a time when the enemies were bringing the dark clouds of war, they said, adding the journey helped them enshrine Kim Jong Il's patriotism.
					
					 The telegram reflected their firm determination to safely arrive at Mangyongdae by speeding up the march with strong will and in the spirit of collectivism.

articles.title: Scientific Successes Gain in Scope in DPRK
articles.content:
Scientific Successes Gain in Scope in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- Scientists and technicians of the State Academy of Sciences in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea have achieved big successes in updating the nation's economy.
					 At the Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex, they succeeded in putting the roughing process of the hot rolling shop on a PLC system while working hard to computerize the processes on a higher level.
					
					 At the Sunchon Chemical Complex, they are buckling down to introducing the process of smelting-reduction iron production by use of oxygen heat.
					
					 In the meantime, a number of major factories have been put on a CNC basis throughout the country.
					
					 At the February 8 Jikdong Youth Coal Mine, geologists invented a device capable of prospecting coal bed tens of meters ahead, in cooperation with the mine's technicians.
					
					 Light industrial scientists made a contribution to increasing the production and variety of tetron rayon fabrics by inventing a new weaving technology and helping operate the water jet loom at full capacity.

articles.title: Passenger Traffic College Founded in DPRK
articles.content:
Passenger Traffic College Founded in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- Pyongyang Passenger Traffic College has been founded in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 The foundation is aimed to train technicians and management workers needed in passenger traffic field.
					
					 Pak Thae Gun, deputy rector of the college, told KCNA:
					
					 Subjects of the college will include structural design, electronic control, manufacture and technological operation of tram cars, trolley buses and other vehicles.
					
					 The fiver-year college will be opened on April 1. As part of study-while-working educational system, it gives a glimpse of the advantages of the educational policy of the Workers' Party of Korea.

articles.title: Devoted Efforts Made by Great Generalissimos for Production of Consumer Goods
articles.content:
Devoted Efforts Made by Great Generalissimos for Production of Consumer Goods
						
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- A national consumer goods exhibition is going on at the Three-Revolution Exhibition here amid deep interest of people.
					 Looking round the exhibits, the visitors recollect the devoted efforts made by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il for the production of consumer goods.
					
					 In October Juche 40 (1951) when the country was at the height of war, the President visited a light industrial exhibition, stressing the need to rapidly develop the nation's light industry and local industry so as to fully provide the inhabitants with daily necessities.
					
					 In December 1979 he sent samples of knitted hats to light industrial officials to produce similar goods suited to the physical constitution and tastes of Korean women in keeping with the national sentiment and the modern aesthetic sense.
					
					 He personally chose 206 kinds of sundry goods, badly needed for the people's daily life, and examined designs of model consumer goods to raise their quality and quantity.
					
					 True to the noble intention of the President, leader Kim Jong Il made a ceaseless journey of field guidance for the wellbeing of the people in his lifetime.
					
					 He visited the Pyongyang city light industrial goods exhibition in August 1984 and the 2nd Commodity Exhibition at Pyongyang Department Store No. 1 in July 2011, calling for production of more consumer goods on a mass basis and indicating the detailed ways for raising the quality of goods.
					
					 Saying that the country and the people would get benefits as much as their leader's efforts, he continued his field guidance to light industrial factories despite weather conditions until the last moments of his life.
					
					 Among those factories were the Sinuiju Cosmetics Factory and Sinuiju Enameled Ironware Factory.
					
					 Their devoted efforts and feats for the people's happiness and wellbeing will be always remembered and encourage the people to build a thriving nation under the guidance of respected Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: U.S., Wrecker of Peace
articles.content:
U.S., Wrecker of Peace
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- A touch-and-go situation is prevailing on the Korean Peninsula due to the Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises kicked off by the U.S. imperialists, south Korean puppets and other hostile forces.
					 Involved in the DPRK-targeted exercises are nuclear-powered carrier task force loaded with at least 100 nuclear warheads, B-52H and other war means of the U.S. forces for making ground, naval and air nuclear strikes and armed forces of its satellite countries which participated in the last Korean War (1950-1953) under the helmet of the "UN Forces".
					
					 Those hostile moves threw a grave obstacle to the DPRK's efforts to be focused on economic construction so that the people may not tighten their belts any longer on the basis of the war deterrence for self-defence.
					
					 Moreover, the exercises are under way on the Korean Peninsula turned into the world's biggest hotspot, which is little different from nuclear magazine.
					
					 In recent years, the U.S. has amassed huge armed forces in the Asia-Pacific region in line with its new defence strategy in an aim to overpower the region's powers by dint of military strength.
					
					 60 percent of its naval forces were deployed in this region and military bases are being set up in Northeast Asia, Southeast Asia, Oceania and other parts of the region. 
					
					 Meanwhile, the U.S. has formed multi-national military alliances with its allied countries to prevent them from having military collaboration with regional powers. Such moves are intended to lay a siege to the regional powers and sell U.S.-made arms to strife-torn areas. 
					
					 Due to such intervention of the U.S., the Asia-Pacific region is turning into a hotspot where a military conflict may break out any time.
					
					 According to the 2012 report of the Stockholm International Peace Research Institute, Asian and Oceanic nations took 44 percent of world's arms imports from 2007 to 2011 and Asian countries ranked first to fifth among the world's arms importers.
					
					 The increased imports were prompted by the U.S. scheme to spark a fresh arms race in the region by taking advantages of the territorial disputes over islands and borders.
					
					 It is likely that the current situation will cause a devastating result in the region.
					
					 The Asian nations should not side with the U.S. policy towards them, reminiscent of the policy in the anachronistic cold-war era.

articles.title: Archery Comes under Public Attention in DPRK
articles.content:
Archery Comes under Public Attention in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, though busy with his ceaseless inspection of military frontline units, recently watched an archery match between the April 25 Defense Sports Team and the Amnokgang Defense Sports Team and had a picture taken with players.
					 From the ancient times archery has been regarded in Korea as a symbol of resourcefulness and bravery. It was one of the martial arts in the medieval age, along with horse riding, fencing and spearing.
					
					 Archery developed onto a higher level particularly in the period of Koguryo Kingdom (B.C. 277-A.D. 668). King Tongmyong, founder of Koguryo, was called Ju Mong in Korean which means a master hand at archery.
					
					 Archery has been one of the sporting events in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea since the 1960s. The DPRK proved successful in the event in some international tournaments.
					
					 Ri Chol Hyon, senior coach of the Amnokgang Defense Sports Team, told KCNA:
					
					 "It is my plan to develop the nation's archery technique onto a higher level than that in the 1970s-1980s. I am sure that it is one of feasible events for the DPRK.
					
					 The team has paid big efforts to putting the archery training on a scientific basis."
					
					 Inspired by Kim Jong Un's call for winning the world championship in the archery event, the coaches and players of the team are now intensifying training in high spirits.
					
					 Kang Hui Ryon, 19, an archer, said:
					
					 "I was honored to have a picture taken with Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 I will pay up to his expectation with good results in international games."

articles.title: U.S. Attempt to Stifle DPRK Can Never Come True: Minju Joson
articles.content:
U.S. Attempt to Stifle DPRK Can Never Come True: Minju Joson
						
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- The U.S. is chiefly to blame for the situation on the Korean Peninsula which is inching close to a war. It is a daydream for it to provoke the DPRK.
					 Minju Joson Tuesday says this in a bylined commentary.
					
					 Disclosing the deliberate moves of the U.S. to render the situation on the peninsula extremely tense and stifle the DPRK militarily, the commentary goes on:
					
					 The U.S. theories of "provocation from the north" and "threat" are a product of despicable scenario to shift the blame for the tense situation on to the DPRK and knock into shape international cooperation system against it.
					
					 The U.S. is tapping all means and methods including military pressure and economic sanctions to disarm the DPRK at any cost and carry out its policy of stifling the DPRK. Through the Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises being staged under the mask of "defense" and "control", the U.S. seeks to put into practice its dangerous scenario for mounting a preemptive attack on the DPRK's nuclear deterrence for self-defence and holding control of it at one stroke.
					
					 The DPRK is left with no room for other alternative as the U.S. imperialists are encroaching upon its sovereignty while threatening it with nukes.
					
					 Its army and people who always have won victories with the tactics of countering the enemies' moves will answer the enemies' provocation with prompt counterstrike.
					
					 It is their firm will to sweep away the stronghold of war from the earth and build a reunified, prosperous and strongest country on this land.
					
					 The U.S. had better behave itself, clearly understanding their steadfast will to annihilate the enemy and their spirit to win one victory after another.

articles.title: Tok Islets Are Part of Inviolable Territory of Korea: Minju Joson
articles.content:
Tok Islets Are Part of Inviolable Territory of Korea: Minju Joson
						
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, a Japanese secondary school textbook that was used in the first half of the 20th century was opened to the world. In the textbook Tok Islets were specified as part of territory of Korea. The textbook published by the Japanese Meiji School in 1924 contains a map in which the battles fought during the Russia-Japan war were marked. Tok Islets are referred to as part of the territory of Korea in the list of indices of this map.
					 This proves based on historical facts the absurdity of the Japanese reactionaries' "territorial claim to Tok Islets", says Minju Joson Tuesday in a bylined commentary.
					
					 There are not a few historical facts and data and geographical and legislative reasons that point to Korea's dominium over the islets. A lot of the Japanese historical data and even Japanese modern historical data, in particular, indicate that the islets are evidently part of the inviolable territory of Korea, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries persist in their groundless "claim to Tok Islets" because they are contemplating making their past history of aggression repeat.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries think that when Japan first seizes Tok Islets in the eastern tip of Korea, it will be possible to stage a comeback to Korea with the islets as a springboard.
					
					 Japan speaks openly before the world of its attempt to grab the islets, revealing its scenario to stage a comeback to Korea. It claims to Tok Islets, trying to have public believe them as "lost territory" of Japan. This can not be construed otherwise than a brazen-faced action.
					
					 Japan has no justifications to lay territorial claim to the islets which were and will always be part of the territory belonging to Korea.
					
					 Japan would be well advised not to covet for the islets to meet its interests.

articles.title: U.S. to Introduce B-52 into S. Korea
articles.content:
U.S. to Introduce B-52 into S. Korea
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialists announced that they on Tuesday would introduce into south Korea long-range strategic bomber B-52 for a preemptive nuclear strike, according to the south Korean KBS. 
					 This fact was disclosed through the huddle between the U.S. deputy secretary of Defense and the "minister of Defense" of south Korea on Monday. 
					
					 Some days ago, B-52 was busy flying in the air over south Korea in a drill for a preemptive nuclear strike at the DPRK. 
					
					 The U.S. imperialists are set to let the bomber on stand-by on Guam at a time when the joint military exercises Key Resolve are under way at a full-dress stage make sorties to south Korea and planning its continued flights. 
					
					 The warmongers are openly threatening the DPRK, claiming that "it is a message of strong warning to the DPRK and they would counter it by force." 
					
					 In the past the U.S. imperialists used to conduct drills for a preemptive nuclear strike at the DPRK by introducing the strategic bomber quite often. But, it is the first time that they disclosed the aim of its introduction and flight program.
					
					 Meanwhile, they asserted that they would give priority to arms reinforcement in south Korea to militarily pressurize the DPRK, and elaborate on the plan for tightening the anti-DPRK "sanctions".

articles.title: North-targeted Joint War Exercises Protested in S. Korea
articles.content:
North-targeted Joint War Exercises Protested in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- The Emergency Action against War and for Peace on the Korean Peninsula in south Korea which groups over 30 organizations including the Solidarity for Progress and the People's Strength for Building New World held a rally in Seoul on March 16 in protest against the joint military exercises for invading the north.
					 At the rally speakers accused the U.S. and the south Korean authorities of staging the Key Resolve from March 11, escalating tensions on the Korean Peninsula and pushing the situation to the brink of war.
					
					 "Sanctions" and military pressure have been escalated against the north, they said, denouncing the present regime for paying lip service to dialogue while showing no will for peace.
					
					 They demanded the authorities stop at once the war drills for aggression and "sanctions" against the north.

articles.title: Fascist Action against Opposition Party Leader in S. Korea
articles.content:
Fascist Action against Opposition Party Leader in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Seoul District Prosecutor's Office is investigating Ri Jong Hui, representative of the opposition Unified Progressive Party, on charge of violation of the "Security Law", according to south Korean CBS on Sunday.
					 The prosecution authorities took such action for the mere reason that Ri termed the Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises now under way across south Korea drills for invading the north.
					
					 It has already been brought to light that the Key Resolve and Foal Eagle are the north-targeted nuclear war drills with lots of preemptive nuclear attack means involved, pursuant to scenarios for invading the north such as OPLAN 5027.
					
					 That is why south Korean people from all walks of life are staging widespread actions against the joint military exercises.
					
					 Nevertheless, the conservative group complained to the prosecution on March 12, describing Ri's action reflecting the trend of south Korean society as a far-fetched assertion.

articles.title: Koreans in Japan Protest against Japan's Policy of Discrimination against Korean Schools
articles.content:
Koreans in Japan Protest against Japan's Policy of Discrimination against Korean Schools
						
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- There took place an emergency meeting at the Korean Primary, Secondary and High School in Hiroshima Prefecture to protest against the suspension of payment of subsidies to the Korean School in Hiroshima Prefecture on Mar. 1. This meeting was held against the backdrop of unabated actions in various parts of Japan against the Japanese government's unjust policy of discrimination against Korean schools.
					 Present there were Koreans in Japan, students and their parents and Japanese people.
					
					 Speakers at the meeting accused the Hiroshima Prefectural Office of having suspended the payment of subsidies to the above-said school, timed to coincide with the Japanese government's decision on totally excluding Korean schools in Japan from the application of the tuition-waiver program for senior high schools.
					
					 This is obviously an unjust measure, they noted, declaring they would stage dynamic actions to get the issue settled in the future.
					
					 A written request to be sent to the governor of Hiroshima Prefecture was read out at the meeting.
					
					 On the same day the Korean School in Yamaguchi Prefecture held a press conference at the Yamaguchi Prefectural Office at which it issued a statement titled "We strongly protest against the unjust shelving of subsidies to the Korean School in Yamaguchi Prefecture".

articles.title: Action against War Drills Staged in U.S.
articles.content:
Action against War Drills Staged in U.S.
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- An action protesting anti-DPRK war drills by the U.S. and the south Korean warmongers is being carried out in the U.S.
					 The representatives of the International Action Centre and Koreans living in Los Angeles held a parade shouting "No U.S.-s. Korean war drills", "Unjust anti-DPRK sanctions of UNSC" and "We want peace in the Korean Peninsula."
					
					 They vowed to continue an action for peace against a war.
					
					 The branches of the International Action Centre in New York and Los Angeles condemned through internet the "resolution on sanctions" against the DPRK approved by UN Security Council.
					
					 They declared they would wage a joint action with progressive forces in south Korea opposing the U.S. policy for aggression on the DPRK.

articles.title: Day of Sun to Be Celebrated in Guinea
articles.content:
Day of Sun to Be Celebrated in Guinea
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- A Guinean preparatory committee was formed in Conakry on March 12 to celebrate the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (the Day of the Sun).
					 Riyad Chaloub, chairman of the Guinean National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize diverse political and cultural events in the period between March 15 and April 15.

articles.title: Day of Sun to Be Celebrated in Benin
articles.content:
Day of Sun to Be Celebrated in Benin
						
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- A Beninese national preparatory committee was formed in Cotonou on March 12 to celebrate the 101st birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (the Day of the Sun).
					 Hessou Kohovi was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize colorful political and cultural events including meeting and film show to mark the Day of the Sun.

articles.title: Austrian Organizations Reject UNSC's "Resolution on Sanctions" against DPRK
articles.content:
Austrian Organizations Reject UNSC's "Resolution on Sanctions" against DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- Austrian organizations released resolutions on March 7 and 8 to reject a "resolution on sanctions" against the DPRK adopted by the UN Security Council.
					 The Left Bloc of the Austrian Trade Union Federation said in a resolution titled "Solidarity with the DPRK-instant peace talks instead of U.S. imperialist-led war exercises and illegal 'sanctions' by the UN":
					
					 The Left Bloc of the Austrian Trade Union Federation strongly denounces the Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises being staged against the DPRK under the baton of the U.S. imperialists.
					
					 We demand the UNSC withdraw the illegal "resolution on sanctions" against the DPRK and observe the UN Charter on guaranteeing the independence and sovereignty of all states.
					
					 We urge the U.S. to stop the provocative war exercises against the DPRK at once and start the sincere negotiations for concluding a peace treaty.
					
					 The Group of Youth for the Study of Kim Jong Il Juche Idea in Vienna said:
					
					 We oppose the U.S.-south Korea joint military maneuvers being staged on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 We reject any aggression moves against the DPRK and double-standards being applied by the UNSC over the nuclear issue.

articles.title: Organization of New Zealand Demands Replacement of AA with Peace Treaty
articles.content:
Organization of New Zealand Demands Replacement of AA with Peace Treaty
						
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- The New Zealand-DPRK Society released a statement on March 1 to demand the conclusion of a peace treaty on the Korean Peninsula.
					 The statement said:
					
					 This year marks six decades since the conclusion of the Korean Armistice Agreement (AA). By this agreement, active combat actions stopped but the Korean War did not end.
					
					 The Korean War should be put to an end by replacing AA with a peace treaty.
					
					 All the Korean people in the north and the south hope for reunification.
					
					 We are convinced that the only conclusion of a peace treaty will be an important first step for reconciliation and reunification of the Korean nation.

articles.title: Foreign Organizations Denounce UNSC's "Resolution" against DPRK
articles.content:
Foreign Organizations Denounce UNSC's "Resolution" against DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- Egyptian and British organizations denounced and rejected an illegal "resolution" against the DPRK adopted by the UN Security Council.
					 The Egyptian Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea on March 8 stated:
					
					 What is not understandable is that the permanent member states of the UNSC take issue with the nuclear deterrent of the DPRK for self-defence although they have huge nuclear weapons enough to exterminate humankind.
					
					 Negation of the DPRK's right to scientific and technological development is a wanton infringement on international law.
					
					 The DPRK has a legitimate right to bolster its nuclear deterrent for self-defence to cope with the invaders trampling down justice.
					
					 We condemn the UNSC's "resolution" against the DPRK which the countries threatening mankind with nuclear weapons adopted by abusing their status as permanent member states. We brand the "resolution" as a violation of international law and the height of the double-standards that does not deserve even a passing note.
					
					 The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the British Branch of the Korean Friendship Association in a joint statement on March 9 said:
					
					 It is natural for the DPRK valuing independence to reject the UNSC's "resolution" aimed to bring down its socialist system in the DPRK and colonize it.
					
					 The "resolution" is an infringement upon the sovereignty of the DPRK and a negation of the UN Charter.
					
					 We support the unshakable determination of the DPRK to further strengthen its status as a nuclear weapons state and a country launching satellites.

articles.title: Japanese Organizations Denounce U.S.-S. Korea Military Drills
articles.content:
Japanese Organizations Denounce U.S.-S. Korea Military Drills
						
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- Japanese organizations denounced the U.S. and south Korean authorities for their moves for invading the DPRK.
					 The Japan Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea said in a statement on March 9 that the U.S. description of the joint military exercises on the Korean Peninsula as "defensive" is an unjustifiable lie.
					
					 The statement went on:
					
					 The present joint military exercises are dangerous war moves not only aimed to threaten the DPRK but to invade it.
					
					 We strongly demand the U.S. and south Korean authorities stop the military maneuvers at once as they lead the situation on the Korean Peninsula to the brink of a war.
					
					 History proves that sanctions and pressure will never work on the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. should come out for the conclusion of a peace treaty for ending the Korean War.
					
					 On the same day the Tokyo-Pyongyang Rainbow Bridge in a statement branded the U.S.-south Korea joint military maneuvers as dangerous and reckless moves bringing a nuclear war to the peninsula.
					
					 The statement went on:
					
					 The only way for ensuring peace and security on the Korean Peninsula is dialogue, not sanctions.
					
					 The U.S. should stop its hostile policy towards the DPRK at once and come out for dialogue to conclude a peace treaty with it.
					
					 The south Korean "government" should clearly face up to the situation where a touch-and-go war crisis was created and sincerely implement the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration.
					
					 The Japanese government should opt for dialogue for improving the relations with the DPRK, not swimming against the tide of the times.

articles.title: Guinean, Bangladeshi Organizations Denounce U.S.
articles.content:
Guinean, Bangladeshi Organizations Denounce U.S.
						
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- Guinean and Bangladeshi organizations released statements on March 11 to denounce the moves of the U.S. imperialists and their followers to stifle the DPRK.
					 The Guinea-Korea Friendship Association said the hostile acts of the U.S. and its allies against the DPRK have gone beyond the limit.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 To cope with this, the Supreme Command of the Korean People's Army (KPA) declared in a statement by its spokesman that it would take stronger countermeasures.
					
					 The U.S. is now staging the aggression war exercises and leading the situation on the Korean Peninsula to the brink of a war.
					
					 The arch criminal ratcheting up the tension on the peninsula is the U.S. and the forces following it which resort to the moves to stifle the DPRK.
					
					 The UN Security Council has no qualifications to take issue with the DPRK's satellite launch and nuclear test.
					
					 We extend invariable support and solidarity to the Korean people who turned out in the sacred action of justice and fully support the statement issued by a spokesman of the KPA Supreme Command.
					
					 We demand that the UNSC withdraw all sorts of "resolutions" against the DPRK.
					
					 A final victory is on the side of the Korean people who turned out in defending the sovereignty.
					
					 The Bangladesh Institute of the Juche Idea noted:
					
					 The U.S. is holding the aggression war maneuvers on the Korean Peninsula, the greatest hotspot in the world. This proves that the U.S. is a ringleader threatening global peace and security.
					
					 The UN should take issue with the U.S. aggression war exercises against the DPRK that pose threat to the global peace and security and remove the "UN Command", a war tool, without delay.
					
					 We support the DPRK's stand by which it declared it would take more powerful practical countermeasures to cope with the prevailing serious situation.

articles.title: American Organization Demands Stop to War Maneuvers
articles.content:
American Organization Demands Stop to War Maneuvers
						
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- The U.S. Institute for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism released a statement on March 4 to denounce the hostile policy of the U.S. and south Korean authorities against the DPRK and their war exercises to invade it.
					 The statement said the DPRK demands the U.S. government withdraw its hostile policy towards the DPRK.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 If the U.S. government shapes the friendly policy to the DPRK, the two countries will be able to establish the relations of genuine friendship.
					
					 The peoples of the two countries have no antagonism.
					
					 The joint military exercises of the U.S. and south Korean authorities being staged to invade the DPRK arouse great concerns of the world peace-loving people.
					
					 We demand the U.S. government withdraw its hostile policy towards the DPRK and stop the war maneuvers against it for peace and stability of the U.S.
					
					 To test the Korean people's will for defending its sovereignty will not be beneficial to anyone.

articles.title: DPRK's Stance Supported by Regional, Bulgarian Organizations
articles.content:
DPRK's Stance Supported by Regional, Bulgarian Organizations
						
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- A regional organization and a Bulgarian organization expressed full support for the DPRK's stance for safeguarding its sovereignty.
					 The International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions stated as follows on Mar. 12:
					
					 To cope with the heinous moves of the U.S., the DPRK declared that it would nullify the Armistice Agreement and exercise the right to preemptive nuclear strike and destroy the strongholds of the aggressors.
					
					 We admit that this measure is as just as the nuclear test and fully support it.
					
					 Only the DPRK's nuclear deterrence can thwart the U.S. aggression and its use of nuclear weapons.
					
					 We call upon the member states of the UN to curb the U.S. moves for aggression and support the DPRK.
					
					 The Bulgarian Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism noted in its statement on Mar. 10:
					
					 We resolutely denounce the "resolution" passed by the UN Security Council under the plea of the DPRK's self-defensive nuclear test.
					
					 Nuclear weapons of the DPRK are to cope with the nuclear threat by the U.S.
					
					 In other words, they are meant to contain the U.S. moves for aggression and protect the peace on the Korean Peninsula and other parts in the region.
					
					 Any scheme to dismantle the DPRK's nuclear deterrence by imposing "sanctions" will only prod the U.S. into igniting a new war on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 No "sanctions" can ever stop the advance of the DPRK, which is exploring space, developing nuclear technology for peaceful purposes and building an economic power.
					
					 We support all the measures the DPRK has taken for safeguarding its sovereignty and ensuring peace on the Korean Peninsula and other parts in the region.

articles.title: DPRK's Just Cause Supported by Russian Figures
articles.content:
DPRK's Just Cause Supported by Russian Figures
						
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- Russian figures in their statements on March 8 and 9 supported the principled stands clarified by the DPRK. They said no one is allowed to usurp the DPRK's right to peaceful development.
					 Anatoli Dolgachev, chairman of the Far Eastern Association for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism of Russia, said the U.S. and other forces following it have made a big blunder again.
					
					 The chairman went on:
					
					 The anti-DPRK "resolution on sanctions" again approved by the UN Security Council is aimed to impede the peaceful development of socialist Korea.
					
					 All the Koreans, with furious enmity against the U.S., are hitting out at its despicable "sanctions" racket and the world progressives are extending support to them.
					
					 The DPRK has its own right to peaceful development and no one is entitled to encroach on it.
					
					 Konstantin Nikolayev, member of the Russian Association for Friendship and Cultural Cooperation with the DPRK, termed the U.S. the mastermind of all conflicts occurring on the earth, adding:
					
					 It is a well known fact that the U.S. forced the DPRK to have access to nuclear deterrence.
					
					 If a nuclear war breaks out on the earth, the U.S. is to blame for it, no matter who first ignites it.
					
					 Accordingly, the way for saving the earth from nuclear holocaust is for the U.S. to scrap its nuclear weapons first.
					
					 The world should be clearly aware of this fact and urge the U.S. to immediately opt for settling the nuclear issue.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Feats Lauded by Personages of Benin
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Feats Lauded by Personages of Benin
						
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- Personages of Benin praised the exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung at a ceremony of inaugurating the Benin national preparatory committee for celebrating the 101st birth anniversary of Kim Il Sung on Mar. 12.
					 Hessou Kohovi, chairman of the Benin National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea who is chairman of the Benin-Korea Amicable Association "Long Live Kim Jong Il, Supreme Leader", said Generalissimo Kim Il Sung has enjoyed deep respect from the Korean people and the world progressives as not only the eternal President of the DPRK but a great pioneer of the human cause of independence.
					
					 Rector of the Cotonou Institute of Journalism of Benin Pascal Zouncheme, chief of the Benin Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, said the human cause of independence could make a long victorious progress thanks to Kim Il Sung, who created an example in the struggle for liberation of colonial nations and gave an active help to the world oppressed people's struggle for national liberation.
					
					 Kim Il Sung will be alive along with the cause of independence which makes steady progress forward, the rector added.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Praised by Guinean Personage
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Praised by Guinean Personage
						
 Pyongyang, March 19 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung founded the great Juche idea and successfully embodied it, setting a brilliant example in realizing the cause of independence.
					 Riyad Chaloub, chairman of the Guinean National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, said this at the inaugural ceremony of the Guinean preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of the President (the Day of the Sun) held on March 12.
					
					 The chairman went on:
					
					 The President supported and encouraged the people of different countries in their struggle for national liberation against imperialism and fascism and exerted positive efforts for global independence till the last moments of his life.
					
					 He regarded it as his maxim to believe in the people as in Heaven and devoted his whole life to the sacred cause for them.
					
					 Increasingly mounting is the desire of mankind to significantly celebrate the Day of the Sun while lauding his feats.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un se fotografia con participantes en Conferencia Nacional de Industria Ligera
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un se fotografia con participantes en Conferencia Nacional de Industria Ligera
						
Pyongyang, 19 de marzo (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, tomo el dia 19 fotos de recuerdo con los participantes en la Conferencia Nacional de la Industria Ligera.
					El Mariscal dijo que la conferencia fue un conclave que dio acicate al gran avance para la mejora de vida del pueblo en el frente de la industria ligera y que la antorcha de innovacion iniciada en la industria ligera se extendio a la agricultura y la economia en conjunto para que se de un nuevo salto.
					
					Y felicito calurosamente a los participantes quienes cumplieron con satisfaccion sus labores con elevado entusiasmo y participacion activa.
					
					Expreso su esperanza y conviccion de que los trabajadores, funcionarios, cientificos y tecnicos de la rama de industria ligera y otros sectores concernientes, que juegan el papel importante en el mejoramiento de vida del pueblo, cumpliran con sus deberes revolucionarios en el desarrollo de la industria ligera conforme a la demanda de la construccion de un Estado prospero socialista.
					
					Le acompanaron, Choe Yong Rim, Kim Kyong Hui, Kim Ki Nam, Mun Kyong Dok, Ro Tu Chol, Pak Pong Ju, Ri Mu Yong, los secretarios  responsables de comites del PTC en las provincias y los presidentes de los comites populares provinciales.

articles.title: Cientificos de RPDC logran exitos con voluntad de defensa de patria
articles.content:
Cientificos de RPDC logran exitos con voluntad de defensa de patria
						
Pyongyang, 19 de marzo (ACNC) -- Los cientificos y tecnicos de la Academia Estatal de Ciencias de Corea alcanzan nuevos exitos en la investigacion para impulsar la construccion de la potencia economica con el espiritu de defender a ultranza la patria.
					  Los cientificos de la rama de automatizacion acudidos al Complejo Siderurgico Kim Chaek, establecieron el sistema PLC en el tramo de la laminacion del plomo bruto en el proceso del  laminado en caliente y perfeccionaron en el alto  nivel el sistema de control por computacion.
					
					  Los de la rama de metal ferroso ayudan al Complejo Quimico de Sunchon en establecer el proceso tecnico de la fundicion de hierro de reduccion de fusion por el metodo de inyeccion de oxigeno.
					
					  Los cientificos del grupo de investigacion de maquinas de control concentran las fuerzas en la aplicacion de la tecnologia CNC en las principales fabricas y empresas.
					
					  Los del instituto de geologia inventaron un aparato capaz de hacer prospeccion decenas de metros en la galeria estrechando la cooperacion creativa con los tecnicos de la Mina Carbonifera Juventud Jikdong 8 de Febrero, lo cual surte efecto en la produccion.
					
					  Ademas el exito de los cientificos de la rama de industria ligera que contribuyeron a aumentar la produccion y la variedad del hilo de rayon de tetron elevando la tasa de funcionamiento del telar hidraulico y aplicando nueva tecnica del tejido, estimula a los trabajadores de las unidades correspondientes.

articles.title: Instituto Superior de Transporte de Pasajeros de Pyongyang
articles.content:
Instituto Superior de Transporte de Pasajeros de Pyongyang 
						
Pyongyang, 19 de marzo (ACNC) -- Quedo establecido en la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea el Instituto Superior de Transporte de Pasajeros de Pyongyang para formar a los funcionarios tecnicos y administrativos y especialistas imprescindibles en la rama.
					Citado por la ACNC, el vicerrector Pak Thae Gun (57 anos de edad) dijo: 
					
					El instituto esta ocupado por los preparativos del nuevo ano escolar. 
					
					Varias catedras ya elaboraron los planes de leccion para las asignaturas como el diseno estructural, el control electronico, la fabricacion y la administracion tecnica sobre los tranvias y trolebuses. 
					
					El instituto establecio nuevas asignaturas aplicadas e impulsa en etapa final la redaccion de nuevos manuales. 
					
					El instituto de cinco anos iniciara el nuevo ano escolar el primero de abril que viene y desempenara un papel importante en el transporte de pasajeros manifestando la justeza de la politica de educacion del PTC y la vitalidad del sistema de ensenanza para trabajadores.

articles.title: Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU, aparato a favor de despotismo de imperialistas (1)
articles.content:
Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU, aparato a favor de despotismo de imperialistas (1)
						
Pyongyang, 19 de marzo (ACNC) -- Como ya esta conocido, Estados Unidos abuso del Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU para fabricar una tras otra "resoluciones de sancion" tan groseras y crueles cuestionando el lanzamiento de satelite con fines pacificos y la tercera prueba nuclear subterranea de autodefensa de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea. 
					Insatisfecho con tales fanaticas maniobras tendentes a aislar a la RPDC en la arena internacional, movilizo hasta la maquinaria de votacion del Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU.
					
					Los imperialistas cometen el despotismo y las arbitrariedades de toda indole abusando del Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU.
					
					Para satisfacer sus intereses, infringen flagrantemente los intereses y los derechos de los paises pequenos y los independientes y antiimperialistas y convirtieron el Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU en el lugar de "denuncia" igual a la tribuna religiosa de la edad media. 
					
					El abuso del Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU en el designio agresivo de los imperialistas es un crimen nunca tolerable. 
					
					En particular, con motivo del desequilibrio de la fuerza en la palestra internacional despues del fin de la guerra fria, EE.UU. y otros imperialistas propagaron la ley de la selva en el mundo manejando a sus caprichos el Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU, lo cual es el crimen nunca perdonable.
					
					El ataque aereo de 78 dias contra ex Yugoslavia, cometido a finales del siglo XX por las fuerzas de la OTAN bajo el mando de EE.UU., fue una masacre ilegal contra los civiles pacifistas.
					
					En 1998, EE.UU. y otros paises occidentales armaron la campana de presion tildando a Yugoslavia de "criminal de guerra" en cuanto al problema de Kosovo. 
					
					Instigaron al Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU aprobar las resoluciones de prohibir la exportacion de armas a Yugoslavia y de permitir la investigacion de la ONU sobre los "actos de violacion de DDHH" en Kosovo. Por ultimo, hicieron aprobar la resolucion advirtiendo que "tomarian importantes medidas internacionales adicionales" si no se da la tregua en Kosovo.
					
					Esto dio luz verde a la intervencion militar en el problema de Yugoslavia. Y las fuerzas de la OTAN comenzaron en marzo de 1999 el ataque aereo indiscriminado sin recibir el consentimiento del Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU, despreciando la ley internacional. 
					
					"El ataque aereo de la OTAN a Yugoslavia seria la musica funebre de la ONU", "Haria gran sombra al nuevo orden mundial despues de la guerra fria", "Se pone en peligro la existencia de la ONU, fundada con el fin de prevenir los conflictos"
					
					La opinion publica expreso gran indignacion y preocupacion por tales atrocidades ilicitas de la OTAN. 
					
					No es casual el que en la reunion de la Comision de DDHH de la ONU, el vicecanciller ruso de aquel entonces, Vassily Sredin, dijo que "hoy Yugoslavia se hace blanco de ataque, y manana, sera atacado otro pais".
